skillTree.localised_description: Exalted Chariots are a blur of chromatic scythes and slicing blades pulled by Slaanesh's steeds.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: This token of Slaanesh's appreciation was the first marker that Rathan had from the Prince of Pleasure, and the specially shaped ring bequeathed Rathan extra stamina in the pursuit of Slaanesh's goals.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 15% for Clan Grudge units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Purloined from an ancient and abandoned Dwarven hold, this book has been corrupted by many hours of ritual and perversion, until finally it screamed forth with the voice of a Daemon, and not a Dawi.

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: As an aid to spellcasting, they are peerless. It is highly dangerous, of course, but a sure-fire route to limitless power.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +13
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one’s writhing form can slowly caress and tease, but also move like lightning when required, knocking a projectile from the air or batting it back at the foe.
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
Rathan's awakening into the ways of Slaanesh took rather than longer than it did for other beings, but once there, he experimented with all of the ways that he could receive Slaanesh's pleasure.
Rathan's dedication to Slaanesh was so regular and repeated that the Prince of Pleasure took notice, and began to gift this strangely-furred worshipper with daemonic gifts.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage and Weapon strength : +10% for Daemonettes of Slaanesh
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Daemonettes of Slaanesh
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Sprinkled with a small hint of the daemonic gifts of Slaanesh, the forces of Rathan become poised on the precipice between this world and the next.

effects.description:
Range: +20%  for Clan Grudge range units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Enables Soporific Musk attacks for Clan Grudge units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The rats of Clan Grudge penetrate the formation of their enemies from every direction, but most preferably from behind.

effects.description:
Speed: +15% for Clan Grudge units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who have tasted of the heady musk of the God of Obsession throw themselves forward, seeking to exceed even Rathan in their pursuit of Ectasy.

effects.description:
Upkeep cost: -25% for Clan Grudge units
	(Lord's army)

Recruit rank: +2 for Clan Grudge units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Reborn in a new light, Rathan is no longer a mere rat, but rather a Daemon of Slaanesh, blessed to carry forth all that the Prince of Pleasure is.

effects.description:
Attribute: Immune to Psychology for Clan Grudge units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases by each enemy unit in range with leadership wavering or lower.

skillTree.localised_description: Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Lash of Slaanesh"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Lash of Slaanesh Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Lash of Slaanesh Upgraded"

Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Hysterical Frenzy Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Hysterical Frenzy Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Slicing Shards"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Slicing Shards Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Slicing Shards Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Phantasmagoria Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having to hide, for an extended period, in a dark, dank recess, in order to entrap and kill your target encourages lateral thinking.

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing exactly where and when to strike is essential when fielding fiendish, potentially battle-winning plague-weapons.

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

skillTree.localised_description: This one has seen the hideous deformities created by Clan Moulder firsthand and now fancies himself a dab hand with a needle and thread…

skillTree.localised_description: This one's intimate knowledge of the inner workings of Skaven machinery enables him to improve their efficiency on the battlefield.

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Early years spent in the gutter both prepares the ambitious rat for power and schools him in the dirtier, more cut-throat ways of war.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Gutter Runners, Night Runners, Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +20% for Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for Gutter Runners and Night Runners units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one knows just what to say to 'encourage' the very best work from his underling Warp-smiths and technicians.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Weapon Team, Doom-Flayers, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Infantry: +5 for Doomwheel, Doom-Flayers and Warp-Grinders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Weapon Team, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Weapon Team, Doom-Flayer, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
"This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption – as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: Touched by Slaanesh, Clan Grudge is a rather bizarre entry in the litany of the Skaven. And a disliked one.

effects.description: Slaaneshi Daemons: Armies of the Prince of Pleasure can be purchased with food, although they will remain only a short while before returning to his domain.
Slaaneshi Undercities: When establishing undercities, the city above can be gifted to a Slaaneshi faction for rewards.
Diplomatic relations: +10 with Warriors of Chaos and Norsca

Upkeep: +300% for all non-Grudge units
	(all armies)

Recruitment cost: +300% for all non-Grudge units
	(all armies)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases as the unit takes damage

effects.description: Immune to Chaos corruption and Chaos Wastes attrition

Physical resistance: 15% for Clan Grudge units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The majesty and the glory that is the Prince of Pleasure has led Rathan to turn his eyes away from the Horned Rat and towards the youngest of the Chaos Gods, leading his people into apostasy, but receiving many blessings in turn, for Slaanesh is amused by his strangely furred apostle.
